description:
Octave has improved so much in the last couple of years in terms of Matlab compatibility. It now runs all the preset GUIs objects of matlab and with only a little care you can write your own dialogues that run in both Matlab and Octave as well. Most of the other minor things you had to do differently between Matlab and Octave are now compatible. The only things left seem to the speed and running full blown GUI interfaces built with Matlab's GUIDE. The Octave interface is also as good as Matlabs now with debugging editor etc. On linux Octave beats Matlab for the readbility of the interface especially on hdpi screens which Matlab has not yet addressed (as of vers Matlab 2018a at least). Matlab still has it on speed and of course its enormous cost (when you get out of school, that is). 
The Flatpak seems like the pretty best option for running on Linux as it is up to date and easier than compiling it yourself given the large number of dependencies. 

Hats off and cheers to the Octave developers!
I'm a high school student and this thing got me an 'A' in my calculus maths assignment.

This program is a highly powerful tool that can be used as everything from a simple calculator to a plotting program to advanced data analysis and simulations. It has most of the features of MATLAB and links well with programs such as Emacs Org-mode providing a great suite of tools that can be used for in-depth data work.
works on ubuntu 19.04

Only thing to remember is ,it should be started from a Terminal with the command : octave  --force-gui
Amazing software.

A minor yet annoying defect is the launch welcome message warning that:
"Could not copy help collection to temporary
file. Search capabilities may be affected.
Cannot unregister index tables in file /usr/share/octave/4.4.1/doc/octave_interpreter.qhc."
summary: A great alternative to the commercial MATLAB algebra system

description: Very good alternative for MATLAB

This was the only version of Octave 5.1 that I could make to work with the graphical interface on Ubuntu 18.04. The Octave 4.2 version that is available on the default repositories is nice, but I missed the variable editor that quite often helps me to figure out errors while handling large arrays. On the other hand, there is a 5.1 version that is available on the default repositories too, but it only includes the command line version. I'm really glad that Flathub had a full 5.1 version of Octave, it saved my day.
summary: The only 5.1 version that worked for me

description: I have completed my coursework on Machine learning and simulations on octave only as the MATLAB was very heavy for my system. Although it's open source but it beats MATLAB in term of ease of use and lightness. And most of it all it's free. Hats off to the developers.
summary: Easy to use and It's free(something unbelievable after using it)

description: I used this tool during a course on Machine Learning and I can't believe that this tool is free. Much respect to the developers behind it!
I can't believe it is free.
It's good but need something like simulink
It is giving matlab for free!
its light, faster and handy and give accurate results.
summary: it is great app, would love to recommend to others

description:
Very small size compared to heftic matlab installation and size.
I hoping that it will also include simulink feature of matlab in future.
If that happened I never have to install matlab again!
I like it so much.
I was trully impressed when I installed it. I was expecting a linux command line tool, and not an amazing MATLAB-like IDE. For de developers, from the bottom of my heart, thank you!
also unable to go in debugging mode
summary: not able to see run tab

description: I love this app
GNU Octave is an excellent free software alternative to MATLAB. It provides amazing functionality and is pretty much just as good as MATLAB.
No way to start this version from GUI in 18.04.4. Had same problem with two other Snap versions of programs. Useless. Need a non-Snap release.
hard to believe this actuall exists for free
It is a very buggy software. This software becomes frezed in runtime. It can harm your pc too.
Forge works perfectly.

This is great tool and to much degree replaces Matlab.

However, had a couple of issues with the snap versions found in the software center:
- can't install all packages such as 'parallel'
- can't access directories outside the user home directory

Installing the native 'non-snap' version with 'apt' resolves these issues.
summary: Great tool, some issues in snap version

description: Really good as a substitution for premium app such as MATLAB
Nice software. It does all the basics for numerical analysis. Highly compatible with Matlab
This is one of the best free alternative to matlab for linux users. give it a try!
summary: One of the best app, would love to recommend!

description: very useful app
Windowing issue. When opening app is blank or maybe some elements is not shown. when plotting graph is not shown and the window becomes transparent .
Pretty light! Fast! and Efficient Thank you developers
i sink it iz De Best soFFFFFteee Vare in De WoLD
For some reason, i can't install this package using terminal
summary: Finally i can install it through here

description: Some minor bugs like the fact that the launch button integrated in the gnome software manager doesn't work
If you are a MATLAB user, you will love it.
Graphs still unusable, at least on a high resolution display. Octave versus MATLAB is a good example of the argument against FOSS being so low quality it's not worth the "free".
summary: Still buggy after all these years

description: this is the latest version of Octave. Love it!
if you let simulink aside, ocatve almost provide every matlab feature, as a telecommunication engineering student this satisfies all my needs.
Me gusta más que Scilab, Spyder o RStudio ya que muchos libros que tengo tienen código en Matlab y este es el único software que me permite realizar los ejercicios de los libros.
summary: Mejor que Scilab, Spyder(Python) o RStudio

description: Es muy fácil realizar los ejercicios propuestos en los libros de texto acerca de Matlab.
summary: Una aplicación excelente para usuarios de Matlab

description: Muy buena alternativa para la realización de cálculos científicos.
Excelente Aplicación para todo lo relacionado con cálculos numéricos
Yo la uso para procesamiento de imágenes y para simulaciones de sistemas de comunicaciones. Es simplemente genial!!

Octave es una de esas joyas de GNU. Super rápida de arrancar y de ejecución de computo tempestuosamente rápida.
Me estoy planteando muy seriamente remplazar Matlab en todas mis computadoras.
a great alternative for matlab.
Para mi es la mejor herramienta para análisis numéricos
mais ne marche pas sur fedora 30 !
Application indispensable pour qui veut faire du calcul scientifique
I use it to learn liquid-sdr, and to check windowing, filtering with ploting. That's all the best.
great tool i like it
